title: Ticket #5468: Have only one timestamp in the ULogEvent class
description:
Right now we have two different timestamps in the ULogEvent class: 

  time_t             eventclock;
  struct tm          eventTime;

The really scary thing is that when a ULogEvent object is created by reading an event from a log, these two don't agree -- the eventTime is set according to the time in the log, but the eventclock is just the time at which the ULogEvent object was constructed(!).

I can fix the immediate problem by also setting eventclock when we read an event; but I think we should only have one of these in the actual class, to avoid confusion and future problems like the current one.
remarks: fix for #6936 resolves this issue. it removes the eventTime field and makes the eventClock field the only timestamp in the event object.
